sen.j: はらこ飯（はらこめし）は、炊いた飯の上に、サケの身とイクラ（はらこ）を乗せたもの。
sen.e: Harakomeshi is a dish in which cooked rice is served with salmon flesh and salmon roe placed on top.
Harakomeshi is a dish in which cooked rice is served with salmon flesh and salmon roe placed on top.
Harakomeshi is a dish in which cooked rice is served with salmon flesh and salmon roe placed on top.

sen.j: 仙台駅や盛岡駅など東北地方各地で駅弁としても売られている。
sen.e: It is also sold as ekiben (a box lunch sold on a train or at a station) in various places in the Tohoku region such as Sendai Station and Morioka Station.
It is also sold as ekiben (a box lunch sold on a train or at a station) in various places in the Tohoku region such as Sendai Station and Morioka Station.
It is also sold as ekiben (a box lunch sold on a train or at a station) in various places in the Tohoku region such as Sendai Station and Morioka Station.

sen.j: サケとイクラを用いる丼
sen.e: Rice bowl which uses salmon and salmon roe
Rice bowl which uses salmon and salmon roe
Rice bowl which uses salmon and salmon roe

sen.j: はらこ飯（サケの切り身を煮てのせる）
sen.e: Harakomeshi (salmon fillet is cooked and placed on top)
Harakomeshi (salmon fillet is cooked and placed on top)
Harakomeshi (salmon fillet is cooked and placed on top)

sen.j: 宮城県亘理郡亘理町に伝わる郷土料理としての「はらこ飯」は、鮭の煮汁でご飯を炊くため、ご飯の色は茶色である。
sen.e: In the "harakomeshi" which has been handed down as a local dish in Watari Town, Watari County, Miyagi Prefecture, rice is cooked with salmon broth; as such, the color of rice is brown.
In "harakomeshi" which has been handed down as a local dish in Watari Town, Watari County, Miyagi Prefecture, rice is cooked with salmon broth; as such, the color of rice is brown.
In "harakomeshi" which has been handed down as a local dish in Watari Town, Watari County, Miyagi Prefecture, rice is cooked with salmon broth; as such, the color of rice is brown.

sen.j: 宮城県気仙沼市周辺、岩手県、新潟県の「はらこ飯」は、普通に白米を炊いたご飯を用いることが多いため、ご飯の色は白色である。
sen.e: The "harakomeshi" that is common in the surroundings of Kesennuma City, Miyagi Prefecture, and in Iwate and Niigata Prefectures usually uses rice which is cooked in an ordinary manner; as such, the color of rice is white.

The "harakomeshi" that is common in the surroundings of Kesennuma City, Miyagi Prefecture, and in Iwate and Niigata Prefectures usually uses rice which is cooked in an ordinary manner; as such, the color of rice is white.

The "harakomeshi" that is common in the surroundings of Kesennuma City, Miyagi Prefecture, and in Iwate and Niigata Prefectures usually uses rice which is cooked in an ordinary manner; as such, the color of rice is white.

sen.j: その他（サケの刺身をのせる）
sen.e: Others (fresh slices of raw salmon are placed on top)
Others (fresh slices of raw salmon are placed on top)
Others (fresh slices of raw salmon are placed on top)

sen.j: 鮭を煮ることなしに、刺身のまま白いご飯の上にのせ、イクラを添えた場合は「鮭いくら丼」「サケ親子丼」などと呼ばれる。
sen.e: If, instead of cooked salmon, fresh slices of raw salmon are placed on top of white rice along with salmon roe, then the dish is called "sake ikura don" (salmon rice bowl with salmon roe), "sake oyako don" (salmon rice bowl with salmon roe), and other such names.

If, instead of cooked salmon, fresh slices of raw salmon are placed on top of white rice along with salmon roe, then the dish is called "sake ikura don" (salmon rice bowl with salmon roe) or "sake oyako don" ("oyako" meaning parent and child; the salmon being the "parent" and the roe being the "child").
sen.cmt: 「サケ親子丼」の定義を「鮭いくら丼」と区別して訳出
sen.e: If, instead of cooked salmon, fresh slices of raw salmon are placed on top of white rice along with salmon roe, then the dish is called "sake ikura don" (salmon rice bowl with salmon roe) or "sake oyako don" ("oyako" meaning parent and child; the salmon being the "parent" and the roe being the "child").

sen.j: ご飯が寿司飯の場合は、ちらし寿司の一種として様々な名称で呼ばれる。
sen.e: If vinegared rice is used, then the dish is considered as a kind of chirashi zushi (vinegared rice with thin strips of egg, pieces of raw fish, vegetables and crab meat arranged on top) and various names are given accordingly.

If vinegared rice is used, then the dish is considered as a kind of chirashi zushi (vinegared rice with thin strips of egg, pieces of raw fish, vegetables and crab meat arranged on top) and various names are given accordingly.

If vinegared rice is used, then the dish is considered as a kind of chirashi zushi (vinegared rice with thin strips of egg, pieces of raw fish, vegetables and crab meat arranged on top) and various names are given accordingly.

sen.j: 亘理の「はらこ飯」
sen.e: "Harakomeshi" in Watari
"Harakomeshi" in Watari
"Harakomeshi" in Watari

sen.j: 阿武隈川の河口付近にある亘理地方（亘理町荒浜）では、鮭の地引網漁が盛んであった。
sen.e: In the Watari region (Arahama, Watari Town) near the mouth of Abukuma-gawa River, beach seine fishery of salmon was popular.
In the Watari region (Arahama, Watari Town) near the mouth of Abukuma-gawa River, beach seine fishery of salmon was popular.
In the Watari region (Arahama, Watari Town) near the mouth of Abukuma-gawa River, beach seine fishery of salmon was popular.

sen.j: 大漁の時に漁師が振舞ったのが、はらこ飯と言われている。
sen.e: It is said that harakomeshi was served by fishermen when they had a good catch.
It is said that harakomeshi was served by fishermen when they had a good catch.
It is said that harakomeshi was served by fishermen when they had a good catch.

sen.j: 江戸時代に入り領主となった伊達政宗が阿武隈川修繕の視察に亘理地方を訪れた。
sen.e: At the start of the Edo period, Masamune DATE, who became the feudal lord, visited Watari region for inspection of renovation work at Abukuma-gawa River.
At the start of the Edo period, Masamune DATE, who became the feudal lord, visited Watari region for inspection of renovation work at Abukuma-gawa River.
At the start of the Edo period, Masamune DATE, who became the feudal lord, visited Watari region for inspection of renovation work at Abukuma-gawa River.

sen.j: このとき地元の漁師からはらこ飯が献上されたといわれている。
sen.e: On this occasion, harakomeshi was presented to him by local fishermen.
On this occasion, harakomeshi was presented to him by local fishermen.
On this occasion, harakomeshi was presented to him by local fishermen.

sen.j: 鮭を、切り身と筋子に分ける。
sen.e: Salmon is separated into fillet and sujiko (ovaries of the salmon).
Salmon is separated into fillet and sujiko (ovaries of the salmon).
Salmon is separated into fillet and sujiko (ovaries of the salmon).

sen.j: 筋子をほぐし、イクラにする。
sen.e: Sujiko is loosened to make salmon roe.
The eggs in the sujiko are separated to make roe.
The eggs in the sujiko are separated to make roe.

sen.j: 醤油・日本酒・砂糖などの割り下を用いて、鮭の切り身を煮る。
sen.e: Salmon fillet is cooked with stock mixed with soy sauce, sake, sugar, and the like.
Salmon fillet is cooked with stock mixed with soy sauce, sake, sugar, and the like.
Salmon fillet is cooked with stock mixed with soy sauce, sake, sugar, and the like.

sen.j: 残った煮汁を薄めたものでご飯を炊く。
sen.e: Leftover broth is diluted to cook rice with it.
Leftover broth is diluted to cook rice with it.
Leftover broth is diluted to cook rice with it.

sen.j: ご飯の上にイクラ、鮭の切り身を盛ってできあがり。
sen.e: Salmon roe and salmon fillet are placed on top of rice, and the dish is complete.
Salmon roe and salmon fillet are placed on top of rice, and the dish is complete.
Salmon roe and salmon fillet are placed on top of rice, and the dish is complete.

sen.j: 醤油で煮た鮭の切り身をほぐしてご飯と混ぜ合わせることも多い。
sen.e: Often salmon fillet is cooked with soy sauce, loosened, and mixed with rice.
Often salmon fillet is cooked with soy sauce, separated, and mixed with rice.
Often salmon fillet is cooked with soy sauce, separated, and mixed with rice.

sen.j: その場合、鮭の身を混ぜ合わせたご飯の上にイクラを盛る。
sen.e: In such case, salmon roe is placed on top of the rice which is mixed with salmon flesh.
In such case, salmon roe is placed on top of the rice which is mixed with salmon flesh.
In such case, salmon roe is placed on top of the rice which is mixed with salmon flesh.

sen.j: 店によっては鮭のあら汁とともに供される。
sen.e: Some restaurants may serve it with fishhead soup of salmon.
Some restaurants may serve it with fishhead soup of salmon.
Some restaurants may serve it with fishhead soup of salmon.

sen.j: 本来郷土料理である為、イクラの盛り方に各家庭で若干のちがいがある（「生のまま」・「軽く湯がく場合」・「表面が白くなる程度まで加熱」）。
sen.e: Since it is originally a local dish, the manner of topping salmon roe may be slightly different depending on the household ("served raw", "lightly boiled", "cooked until the surface turns white").
Since it is originally a local dish, the manner of topping salmon roe may be slightly different depending on the household ("served raw", "lightly boiled", "cooked until the surface turns white").
Since it is originally a local dish, the manner of topping salmon roe may be slightly different depending on the household ("served raw", "lightly boiled", "cooked until the surface turns white").

sen.j: 専門店では、なまぐささを除去するために軽く白濁しない程度に湯がいて供される場合が多い。
sen.e: In some specialty shops, salmon roe is often boiled, lightly before the water turns cloudy, in order to remove the fishy smell.
In some specialty shops, salmon roe is often boiled, lightly before it turns cloudy, in order to remove the fishy smell.
sen.cmt: 白濁するのは水ではなく、いくらなので変更
sen.e: In some specialty shops, salmon roe is often boiled, lightly before it turns cloudy, in order to remove the fishy smell.

sen.j: 近年各TVメディアで放映され、全国区的知名を得ている。
sen.e: Recently harakomeshi was broadcasted on various TV media and acquired national publicity.
sen.cmt: 【全国区的】→【全国的】と解釈しました。Webでも【全国区的】となっていたため原文を修正しませんでした。
sen.e: Recently harakomeshi was broadcasted on various TV media and acquired national publicity.
Recently harakomeshi was broadcasted on various TV media and acquired national publicity.

sen.j: 秋季が旬であるが、亘理地方では他季節には、ホッキめし（冬）・しゃこめし（春）・アサリめし（夏）が提供される。
sen.e: The season for harakomeshi being autumn, during other seasons, hokki meshi (Sakhalin-surf-clam rice) (Winter), shako meshi (mantis shrimp rice) (Spring), and asari meshi (Manila clam rice) (Summer) are served in the Watari region.

The season for harakomeshi being autumn, during other seasons, hokki meshi (Sakhalin-surf-clam rice) (Winter), shako meshi (mantis shrimp rice) (Spring), and asari meshi (Manila clam rice) (Summer) are served in the Watari region.

The season for harakomeshi being autumn, during other seasons, hokki meshi (Sakhalin-surf-clam rice) (Winter), shako meshi (mantis shrimp rice) (Spring), and asari meshi (Manila clam rice) (Summer) are served in the Watari region.

sen.j: 「鮭親子丼」、あるいは、「鮭いくら丼」と知られている丼物の場合は、白米の上にサケやイクラを並べただけだが、はらこ飯の場合はご飯にも味付けがなされるところが異なる。
sen.e: Donburi-mono (rice bowl dish) that are known either as "sake ikura don" or "sake oyako don" are served simply by placing salmon and salmon roe on top of white rice; whereas harakomeshi differs from other such dishes in that the rice is flavored as well.

Donburi-mono (rice bowl dish) that are known either as "sake ikura don" or "sake oyako don" are served simply by placing salmon and salmon roe on top of white rice; whereas harakomeshi differs from other such dishes in that the rice is flavored as well.

Donburi-mono (rice bowl dish) that are known either as "sake ikura don" or "sake oyako don" are served simply by placing salmon and salmon roe on top of white rice; whereas harakomeshi differs from other such dishes in that the rice is flavored as well.

sen.j: 盛岡駅が東北新幹線の終着駅だった頃は、八戸・青森方面の特急はつかりに乗り継ぐ乗客に人気のあった駅弁でもあった（青森県は地域を問わず、鮭の切り身やイクラの消費量が多い）。
sen.e: When Morioka Station was the terminal of Tohoku Shinkansen (line), harakomeshi was a popular ekiben for passengers who made connections to the Limited Express "Hatsukari" in the direction of Hachinohe Station and Aomori Station (the consumption of salmon fillet and salmon roe is great in Aomori Prefecture, regardless of the area).
sen.cmt: Webで確認し、【八戸・青森方面のつがる (列車)盛岡・八戸～青森・弘前間 東北新幹線連絡列車「はつかり」・「つがる」に乗り継ぐ】を【八戸・青森方面の特急はつかりに乗り継ぐ】に修正しました。
sen.e: When Morioka Station was the terminal of Tohoku Shinkansen (line), harakomeshi was a popular ekiben for passengers who made connections to the Limited Express "Hatsukari" bound for Hachinohe Station and Aomori Station (the consumption of salmon fillet and salmon roe is great in Aomori Prefecture, regardless of the area).

When Morioka Station was the terminal of Tohoku Shinkansen (line), harakomeshi was a popular ekiben for passengers who made connections to the Limited Express "Hatsukari" bound for Hachinohe Station and Aomori Station (the consumption of salmon fillet and salmon roe is great in Aomori Prefecture, regardless of the area).

sen.j: また、上野-青森間を走行していた急行十和田（のちに八甲田に替わる）が定期運行されていた時代は、下り列車（上野発）では後続の電車寝台特急に抜かれるのを待つため、朝の6時50分～7時間に盛岡駅で停車時間を長めに取るダイヤになっており、多客時には朝ご飯として買い求める乗客で売り切れることもあった。
sen.e: Furthermore, during the time when the Limited Express "Towada" (later replaced by "Hakkoda"), which ran from Ueno Station to Aomori Station, was in regular service, the timetable was set to give a rather long standing time for the downtrain (departing from Ueno Station) at Morioka Station during 6:50 and 7:00 in the morning to wait to be overtaken by the successive train, an overnight train service; accordingly, harakomeshi was sometimes sold out when there were many passengers buying the ekiben for breakfast.
sen.cmt: Webで確認し、【上野-青森間を走行していた東北本線優等列車沿革戦後・急行「みちのく」とその周辺列車群（のちに東北本線優等列車沿革戦後・急行「みちのく」とその周辺列車群に替わる）が】を【上野-青森間を走行していた急行十和田（のちに八甲田に替わる）が】に修正しました。
sen.e: Furthermore, during the time when the Limited Express "Towada" (later replaced by "Hakkoda"), which ran from Ueno Station to Aomori Station, was in regular service, the timetable was set to give a rather long standing time for the downtrain (departing from Ueno Station) at Morioka Station during 6:50 and 7:00 in the morning to wait to be overtaken by the successive train, an overnight train service; accordingly, harakomeshi was sometimes sold out when there were many passengers buying the ekiben for breakfast.

Furthermore, during the time when the Limited Express "Towada" (later replaced by "Hakkoda"), which ran from Ueno Station to Aomori Station, was in regular service, the timetable was set to give a rather long standing time for the downtrain (departing from Ueno Station) at Morioka Station during 6:50 and 7:00 in the morning to wait to be overtaken by the successive train, an overnight train service; accordingly, harakomeshi was sometimes sold out when there were many passengers buying the ekiben for breakfast.
